isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR - ...COOLANT IN LUBRICATING OIL OR LUBRICATING OIL IN COOLANT

svcproc.title: ...COOLANT IN LUBRICATING OIL OR LUBRICATING OIL IN COOLANT

step3.para: Cracked or porous cylinder head - top deck, valve bridge blown head gasket.
Porous or cracked crankcase - in area of main bearing crankcase webbing.
Lube oil cooler (cracked or loose tubes or cut o-rings).
Drain all lube oil and coolant from engine and radiator.
Disconnect the radiator from the engine and cap off all the engine connections (with hose clamps and plugs).
Disconnect the unit's cab heater connections at the engine and cap engine openings.
Disconnect air compressor coolant supply and discharge (return) lines, then cap lines at engine.
Disconnect and leave open oil supply return line to crankcase from air compressor (if equipped).
Remove the valve covers, fuel injection pump, intake manifold, valley pan, push rods, lube oil pan and drain plug from the lube oil cooler.

note.para: Block off the core clean out ports in the cylinder head (Prior to S/N 598726).

step3.para: Fill the engine with water and attach an air line connection coupled with a regulator assembly to the water drain in cylinder block.
Pressurize the crankcase cooling system to 30 psi. Pressure must be maintained until leakage location is evident. It may be necessary for the engine to remain pressurized overnight to locate leakage.
It is essential that all points of leakage be identified prior to tear down and repair. NO EXTERNAL OR INTERNAL LEAKAGE IS ALLOWABLE.

step1.para: When the location of the leak is found and repaired, clean the contaminated engine using Butyl Cellosolve or Butyl Jaysolve as directed.
